pullRequest.title: CLOUD-59: Programmatic API for preboot and postboot commands in Micro
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
This is a feature. 
Adds methods setPreBootHandler and setPostBootHandler that offer functionality similar to --prebootcommandfile and --postbootcommandfile of Payara Micro jar.
The methods accept Consumer of CommandRunner, allowing the user to also inspect the output of the commands, and direct their flow.
Two secondary things are addressed with this PR:

38a8641 adds flatten plugin to Payara Micro distribution. The installed POM does not contain any dependencies anymore, making it equal with release POM.
2abfc10 adds more diagnostic information to failure of Bulkhead tests, as I've experienced some during development.




Important Info
Dependant PRs 
Alternative to #4600

Testing
New tests
PayaraMicroCommandsTest tests and demonstrated the API.

Testing Performed

Test suites executed


Payara Samples

Testing Environment

OpenJ9 1.8.0_242 on Windows 10, Maven 3.6.3
Documentation
Javadoc comments were added, documentation update pending.

commit.message: CLOUD-59: API for executing pre- and post-boot commands programmatically

CLOUD-59: Flatten payara micro jar

Installed jar will not have any dependencies, making it same to release jar.
Prevents hiding classpath-related problems when working with snapshot.
Extend diagnostic information for failing bulkhead tests

nodes.bodyText: Don't know how the dependencies look like but it might be possible to have CommandRunner implement AdminCommandRunner and have CommandResult implement ClusterCommandResult.

As discussed I believe the issue here is that the async worker entering and exiting the bulkhead also sets the result in test code after having left the bulkhead. At that point the main thread can see all workers exited the bulkhead and starts to assert but there is no synchronisation forcing it to wait until the worker also has set its result. This part has to be outside of the bulkhead. So a proper fix is to introduce some kind of waiting in the main thread that keeps track of the workers and if they have set the result. This is by no means a request to do such a change in this PR but meant to document the issue. We should address it in a separate PR.
A javadoc on what this runner does or where its roll is compared to other runners and why this is needed would be nice.
